skill.name: algorithmic-art
skill.description: Creating algorithmic art using p5.js with seeded randomness and interactive parameter exploration. Use this when users request creating art using code, generative art, algorithmic art, flow fields, or particle systems. Create original algorithmic art rather than copying existing artists' work to avoid copyright violations.

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill with minimal audit applied. No security issues found in scanned text files. Templates load external assets from CDNs.

content.value_statement: You need original algorithmic art that is reproducible and easy to explore. This skill provides a seeded viewer template and guidance for your custom p5.js system.
actual_capabilities: Provides a viewer HTML template with sidebar, seed controls, sliders, and color pickers.
Loads p5.js from cdnjs and fonts from Google Fonts.
Includes seed navigation functions for previous, next, and random seeds.
Supplies a generator template with seeded randomness helpers and utility functions.
Defines parameter update and regeneration hooks for interactive exploration.
limitations: Requires internet access to load p5.js and fonts from CDNs.
Does not implement a finished art algorithm; you must create the system.
Outputs are standalone HTML artifacts, not hosted deployments.
High particle counts can reduce browser performance.

use_cases.title: Prototype a new system
use_cases.description: Build a seeded p5.js sketch with tunable parameters for rapid visual experimentation.

use_cases.title: Teach generative logic
use_cases.description: Show how parameters and seeded randomness shape emergent behavior in a live viewer.

use_cases.title: Explore visual directions
use_cases.description: Share interactive variations using a single self contained HTML file.

prompt_templates.title: Beginner philosophy
prompt_templates.scenario: You want a simple first idea
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a short algorithmic philosophy for calm flow fields and list three parameters with ranges for a seeded p5.js viewer.

prompt_templates.title: Particle trails
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a philosophy for drifting particles and define parameters for count, speed, trail length, and noise scale.

prompt_templates.title: Subtle concept seed
prompt_templates.prompt: Use coastal fog as a subtle seed and propose a p5.js system with seeded randomness and gentle parameter controls.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced interactions
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a high craft philosophy for two interacting fields and specify parameters, color controls, and a regeneration plan.

output_examples.input: Create a philosophy and plan for seeded flow fields with adjustable density.
output: Movement name with a brief philosophy that centers on reproducible emergence
Parameter list with density, speed, and noise scale plus clear ranges
Viewer outline with seed controls, sliders, and optional color pickers

best_practices: Use seeded randomness for reproducible variations.
Keep parameters in a single object for easy updates.
Regenerate the system when major parameters change.
anti_patterns: Copying a specific artist style or protected work.
Removing seed controls that enable reproducibility.
Setting particle counts so high that the browser freezes.

faq.question: What platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Any modern browser that can run HTML, CSS, and JavaScript with p5.js.

faq.question: Are there output limits?
faq.answer: Outputs are guidance and templates, not pre rendered images or hosted files.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into my app?
faq.answer: Yes. Embed the single HTML viewer and inline p5.js code in your project.

faq.question: How is my data handled?
faq.answer: The templates do not include data storage or external transmission.

faq.question: What if the sketch runs slowly?
faq.answer: Reduce particle counts, simplify calculations, or lower canvas size.

faq.question: How does it compare to static art tools?
faq.answer: It focuses on procedural systems with reproducible variation, not manual image editing.
